item.title: Tron: Legacy
item.dc:creator: bfp
item.description: There’s nothing like the task of a Canadian tax return to drive you to blockbuster DVD night, but boy was Tron: Legacy bad. Although seeing Bruce Boxleitner (really recognizing his voice, because it’s been a few cycles) made me start jonesing for Babylon 5 once more.
item.content:encoded: There’s nothing like the task of a Canadian tax return to drive you to blockbuster DVD night, but boy was Tron: Legacy bad. Although seeing Bruce Boxleitner (really recognizing his voice, because it’s been a few cycles) made me start jonesing for Babylon 5 once more.

item.title: The American
item.dc:creator: bfp
item.description: George Clooney, Assassins, Italy, Wonderful Photography. A lot of capitals there; good if you like a tight thriller with no explosions.
item.content:encoded: George Clooney, Assassins, Italy, Wonderful Photography. A lot of capitals there; good if you like a tight thriller with no explosions.

item.title: Summer Blockbusters – a list

item.description: I find myself nodding my head a lot at this list from Time Out (New York) – 30 biggest summer movies.
item.content:encoded: I find myself nodding my head a lot at this list from Time Out (New York) – 30 biggest summer movies.

item.title: Lucy’s First Cinema (Film: How to Train a Dragon)
item.dc:creator: bfp
item.description: I wanted it to be Star Wars. This was at least 5 years too old for her. I think she loved it. Recommended 4/5. Today she asked to go see it again.
item.content:encoded:
I wanted it to be Star Wars. This was at least 5 years too old for her. I think she loved it.

Recommended 4/5.

Today she asked to go see it again.

item.title: Someone else nailed it! (Star Trek Geekery Warning!)
item.dc:creator: master
item.description: Mitch Wagner (don’t really know who he is, but his Star Trek re-watch reviews have been fun) just nailed it on tor.com (lives in my feeds) with Something that really bugs me about the recent Star Trek movie. I knew I had a sour or two taste in my mouth after the mostly enjoyable Star … Continue reading "Someone else nailed it! (Star Trek Geekery Warning!)"
item.content:encoded:
Mitch Wagner (don’t really know who he is, but his Star Trek re-watch reviews have been fun) just nailed it on tor.com (lives in my feeds) with Something that really bugs me about the recent Star Trek movie.

I knew I had a sour or two taste in my mouth after the mostly enjoyable Star Trek re-boot movie, and I think this was one of them. (The whole “time travel in Star Trek” was another, and a desperate need for beer was another).

item.title: Progress (see also “definitive physicality”)
item.dc:creator: bfp
item.description: My progress has been stunning. Our progress has been stunning. Even though our need to sell is no longer burning, we are so damn close – the to-do list is somewhat dented and we could turn it around at any time in a frenzied week. And then we would have to move out or at … Continue reading "Progress (see also “definitive physicality”)"
item.content:encoded:
My progress has been stunning. Our progress has been stunning.

Even though our need to sell is no longer burning, we are so damn close – the to-do list is somewhat dented and we could turn it around at any time in a frenzied week. And then we would have to move out or at least put our child in a box for the duration or something during the “keep it perfect” staging period.

My progress, personally, has continued through a list of things I have no real interest in (*) and don’t want to get better at: painting, deck staining (**), moving furniture, truck driving, touch-up (6 different colours yesterday), woodworking (***), weeding, bird-shit-from-house-cleaning, pretty-flower-planting, ikea-furniture-assembling… However, it still quite amazes me that someone as practically-limited as myself can still manage to produce average results at such a variety of tasks with no training (****). The internet and help from friends definitely makes all the difference.

Our commitment level and progress has led to an almost slacker pace of achievement this weekend (*****). Many things were still done, but we went to a fun BBQ yesterday and this evening I totally ducked the basement (******) and rented a brutally bad movie that I watched with D for brownie points (My Blueberry Nights – 1 bfp star and slow….), I also rented Taken which I’m sure is much better. This was also our first time watching a movie with the girl, which went ok. We’re both kinda freaked that she knows how to play Curious George from Front Row on my Mac though…

This week we buckle down to do some house hunting before some travel gets in the way – our potential house is gone, to a higher or more reliable bidder, and the pickings are scarce. Timetable is on.

—-

(*) not to say there is no sense of achievement for a Program Manager (aka deals with compromise resolution all the time) in Software (aka lives in a virtual world): moving a pile of dirt and changing the colour of a room has a certain definitive physicality to it.

(**) I almost enjoyed this as I borrowed Keith’s pressure washer and used it for the first time. I think I overdid it in a few places, but those things are cool. I think I need to add one to my inventory of tools I almost never use – see (****).

(***) this could be something I could grow to like, but it’s still hacking away with little skill.

(****) although it is nice to use some of those random tools that you buy that makes every trip to Home Depot $300.

(*****) I really slacked – 6 weeks ago I bailed on Saturday’s marathon (the trip to Whistler tipped the balance on my training), in practicality the house meant even the half went bye-bye.

(******) this task is the big remaining elephant, both the shop side (anyone need some random old crappy bikes, and parts?) and the office side (how to make a rat’s nest of cables look clean withough just stuffing all the hard drives and printers under the stairs etc)

item.title: Watchmen – not a review
item.dc:creator: bfp
item.description: My friend Morgan and I are getting frustrated. There’s this big comic-book movie out this week – Watchmen, based on a seminal graphic novel from 23 years ago now that is a little dated (remember the Cold War?) and morally ambiguous. But today’s entertainment is all morally ambiguous, so it’s not that different. But the … Continue reading "Watchmen – not a review"
item.content:encoded:
My friend Morgan and I are getting frustrated. There’s this big comic-book movie out this week – Watchmen, based on a seminal graphic novel from 23 years ago now that is a little dated (remember the Cold War?) and morally ambiguous. But today’s entertainment is all morally ambiguous, so it’s not that different.

But the problem is, we can’t work out if the movie’s a good big-screen blast. We like to go watch big action movies in the Cinerama. It’s great. It almost makes bad movies good.

All the movie reviews are quagmire’s of comparison of the movie to the comic for comic-nerds, or how its not relevant anymore, etc, etc (e.g.). I want to know if I should go watch it. I probably will.

Anyway, in my browsing for a good review, here is Studio 360‘s non-review (embedded audio below) – but it’s really relevant to the cultural impact of the original book, all those years ago.

item.title: The Best Unwatched Movies of 2008
item.dc:creator: bfp
item.description: If you don’t count a start-stop, corner-of-my-eye airplane viewing experience of Speed Racer then I have seen none of these. But the write-ups here make me want to watch each of The 19 Best Movies That You Didn’t See in 2008, even the horror ones.
item.content:encoded: If you don’t count a start-stop, corner-of-my-eye airplane viewing experience of Speed Racer then I have seen none of these. But the write-ups here make me want to watch each of The 19 Best Movies That You Didn’t See in 2008, even the horror ones.

item.title: DVD: Cloverfield
item.dc:creator: bfp
item.description: bfp: 4/5, imdb, amazon short can’t say much without spoiling it “it’s a terrible thing” story from the viewpoint of a camera Japanese movie shot in Manhattan might need to go watch something else JJ Abrams is involved in now, or I might just wait for Star Trek. liked it!
item.content:encoded:
bfp: 4/5, imdb, amazon

  • short
  • can’t say much without spoiling it
  • “it’s a terrible thing”
  • story from the viewpoint of a camera
  • Japanese movie shot in Manhattan
  • might need to go watch something else JJ Abrams is involved in now, or I might just wait for Star Trek.
  • liked it!

However for books I’ve decided to do goodreads ala The Jennifer Morgue so for 2009 I may return to doing movies here. I’ve done so before (ooh, late at night, that English/sentence smells bad). … Continue reading "Movies"
item.content:encoded:
I was Lucy-fied in 2008 and posted comments on Indy 4 and Transformers. I also didn’t watch a lot of movies.

However for books I’ve decided to do goodreads ala The Jennifer Morgue so for 2009 I may return to doing movies here. I’ve done so before (ooh, late at night, that English/sentence smells bad).

Although I watched a movie last night and said nothing.

But tonight I watched Cloverfield.
